text: Feven Ghebremicael, best known as Feven (born 19 October 1975) is a Swedish rap artist. In 2000, she released the music album Hela vägen ut with the charting songs "Dom tio budorden" and "Bränn BH:n". In 2001, she released the music single "Vill ha" featuring Petter. As well as the music single "It's only love". She is a co-writer of the book Svartskallar. On 20 February 2001, she won a Grammis award in the category Hiphop/soulalbum of the Year. Her thank you speech received plenty of attention as she heavily used American street slang. ==Singles== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text- align:center;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Year ! scope="col" colspan="1"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Album |-1 ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"| SWE |-1 ! scope="row"| "Dom tio budorden" | 2000 | 1 | |} ==References== Category:Living people Category:1975 births Category:Swedish female singers Category:21st-century Swedish singers Category:21st-century women singers
title: Feven
